data.title: Just for info
data.text: Nothing overwhelming special. You want some brochures or info about getting around, go here. No biggie

data.title: Good Place for information
data.text: This is a great place to get tourist information in NYC, the location is perfect across from Brooklyn bridge, right on City Hall building, a blocks from World Trade Center, Trinity Church, Wall street, and Fulton St.  You will be able to get all kinds of information while touring the area!!

data.title: Its okay
data.text: Need the city info or attraction info? You will get it here, but is it the best place to get it? Probably not. I much prefer the Times Square one. To be totally honest - get your info on line and come here for the maps if you can't pull them in your phone.

data.title: for a walk or lunch
data.text: nice ambience, relaxed atmosphere small park close to city hall and wall street, stop on the way to brooklyn

data.title: A walk in the park
data.text: Nice to walk around this area when the weather is nice. Bring your snack or lunch or a nice reading material and you can relax . Walk further up and you will see Chinatown.last summer

data.title: Used to eat my lunch at this park and enjoyed an escape from the office
data.text: Such a joy to see trees, flowers (seasonally), fountain and busy life of the City outside of the park

data.title: gorgeous square near the Brooklyn bridge
data.text: After your tour of the financial district or even a trip across the brooklyn bridge, grab a coffee from the nearby starbucks (right across the street), take a seat on a park bench and enjoy some people-watching.

data.title: You will never get lost
data.text: You think you must get lost but think again.  NYC always have a spot where you can visit to get information on all your tourist locations.

data.title: Gorgeous fountain....great little park.
data.text:
During the day light hours (with good warm weather ) the fountain jets liven up the square with a soothing sound
and beautiful waterworks.Very cold freezing winter weather is impossible for a fountain to work well.
Often art exhibits are shown here like garden or outdoor sculptures.
At night the gas light lanterns are turned on and the water is bathed in a golden light standing out against the
background of stunning buildings like the Woolworth art Deco magnificence,and the huge City Hall massive
structure.Also a close view of the Freedom Tower and other new skyscrapers.
A great place to take pictures and to take to take the bus to nearby Chinatown.

data.title: Gorgeous local place near the Mayor's office with the feel for the old days.
data.text: I used to work in the area and it was always a joy to hang out in the park, have a coffee and eat. the style of the gardens gives you a feel for what it used to be like before the modernization of the area.

data.title: Don't go out of your way, but....
data.text: This little old fashioned pocket park is a sweet stop after stumbling around visiting the big downtown attractions.  Get a halal or hot dog from a street cart and sit here to eat it and take a break.  Sometimes there's a funky art installation to ogle, but mostly it's shady and calm even though it's just steps to the street on all sides.  The fountain adds to the pleasant ambiance.

data.title: Historic Park in Lower Manhattan
data.text: The Croton Fountain was one of the first sources of clean water for locals in the early history of Manhattan development. This very small park is worth passing through if your visiting lower Manhattan.

data.title: The Perfect Place For Your New York Questions!
data.text: If you are visiting NYC, all trains converge here, all the things you want to see start within a few blocks of here (the World Trade Center Museum/Trinity Church & Chapel/Wall Street/The Brooklyn Bridge/South Ferry and the boat to the Statue of Liberty/Century 21, etc). The kiosk is well equipped with brochures and people who can point you in the right direction, whatever your destination/urban inclination. But what's nice is to just stop for a while in the busy but beautiful City Hall Park whose triangle shape's south western tip is the home of the info center. The large fountain near the info kiosk is cooling and drowns out the traffic sounds, and there are plenty of places nearby to grab the makings of an impromptu picnic before going off in whatever direction you have in mind. The city's shape narrows here so it's just a short walk: frenetic Chinatown is a few blocks north, South Street Seaport's a few blocks east...the Municipal Building with its NYC themed store is on the northeast corner of City Hall Park...the latter is the perfect place for your NY wedding, by the way, but that's for another review. Questions about that? Ask 'em. They'll answer.

data.title: park
data.text: i love to walk by and just look at the way they have all the trees looking. everything looks so pretty

data.title: Amanzing
data.text: Beautiful places and the garden is unique all the places around is beautiful close to the City Hall .

data.title: Pretty Spot
data.text:
Nice spot with occasional art installations.  A patch of green in the otherwise asphalt surroundings.
Near courthouses, city hall, Woolworth building.

data.title: Stunning landscape
data.text:
A lush garden of seasonal plants in front of City Hall, beautifully maintained and restful, welcoming at any time of
year but especially in Spring.

user_location.name: New York, New York, United States

data.title: Lovely park
data.text: We visited the City Hall Park after walking across the Brooklyn Bridge.  It is a real oasis of calmness within a busy part of Manhattan.  You can sit and soak up all of the atmosphere as well as taking in the City Hall building, Woolworth building and other nice architecture.  There were also loads of squirrels and birds in the park as well as a lovely fountain.

data.title: Lovely
data.text: Lovely park right in the crazy crisis cross of roads in downtown New York. Beautiful fountain, well kept and a peaceful and tranquil place to take 10 minutes to yourself

data.title: Calm and beautiful place
data.text: Calm and quite park, just in the middle of manhattan, near the brooklyn bridge and some other huge buildings. Near 9 11 Memorial also, and worth a stop to have a good look around the tall buildings that surround you as well as the tulips and all the green of the park
